definition: to lift up (sth hanging down)/to raise (hem of skirt)/to pull up (sleeve)/to sprinkle (water with cupped hands)
to push aside with the hand, foot, a stick etc/to dial/to allocate/to set aside (money)/to poke (the fire)/to pluck (a string instrument)/to turn round/classifier: group, batch

sentences.english: Such rays which titillate lovers' hearts and provoke passionate feelings.
sentences.chinese: 光芒撩撥起戀人們的心絃，猶如感到激情澎湃。

sentences.english: He tried in a hundred ways to convey his own feelings, casting arch glances at them.
sentences.chinese: 他乘機百般撩撥，眉目傳情。

sentences.english: She thought I was being romantic playing footsie with her under the table…
sentences.chinese: 她覺得我一直用腳在桌子下面撩撥她實在是太浪漫了。

sentences.english: Both catchy and intriguing, they surprise and titillate the imagination.
sentences.chinese: 上口和耐人尋味的，他們驚喜，撩撥的想象力。

sentences.english: So she spent the next 24 hours lounging around on clouds and playing the harp and singing.
sentences.chinese: 於是她慵懶的躺在雲端，撩撥着豎琴，放聲歌唱。

sentences.english: These stories spoke to me in much the same way railroad timetables had.
sentences.chinese: 這些故事就象當年鐵路時刻表一樣，撩撥着我的心絃。

sentences.english: It sets the tone of your moves and it could heighten the excitement of your performance.
sentences.chinese: 它爲你的撩撥奠定基調而且可以提高你表演的興奮度。

sentences.english: It's time to find the kind titillate the flow.
sentences.chinese: 它的時間去尋找一種撩撥流。

sentences.english: Only Xianzhi spun, would completely transform the mood.
sentences.chinese: 只需要纖指撩撥，心境就全然變換了。

definition: lit. lotus roots may break, but the fiber remains joined (idiom); lovers part, but still long for one another
to obstinately persist in going about things the wrong way (idiom)
to play tricks on/to make fun of/to tease
to question intensely/to interrogate/to demand information
lit. wading in mud and water/a slovenly job/sloppy
now hot, now cold/(of one's mood, affection etc) to alternate
